data.meaning_mnemonic: <radical>Dirt</radical> makes it <radical>easy</radical> to identify your <kanji>location</kanji>. Even if you add an extra line to mark the ground, it's still easy. Keep that in mind and you can go from <kanji>place</kanji> to place.
data.meaning_hint: Imagine looking at the dirt. It's a distinct color and texture, and you're able to identify your location just from that alone. Now draw that line on the ground and you'll always remember this place.
data.reading_mnemonic: Knowing your <kanji>location</kanji> from dirt is quite a feat! Who taught you that? It was <reading>Joe</reading> (じょう), the big local farmhand. Despite being a bit weird, he can identify any <kanji>place</kanji> just from its dirt!
data.reading_hint: Remember Joe? He's our local farmhand who only has nine toes (from the 上 mnemonic). Imagine that guy explaining to you how to know your location from dirt. He may be a bit clumsy, but the man really knows his dirt.
